com.nuance.android.vocalizer

Class VocalizerAudioSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nuance.android.vocalizer.VocalizerAudioSettings

  • public class VocalizerAudioSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a audio output settings to be used while synthesizing speech.

    You can specify custom audio output settings by calling setCustomAudioSettings Note that specifying custom audio settings will increase CPU usage. You should usually let the engine pick the best audio settings for the current voice.
    Author:
    Nuance Communications

      • VocalizerAudioSettings

        public VocalizerAudioSettings(int rate,
                              int channels)
        Constructs a VocalizerAudioSettings instance with the given audio settings.
        Parameters:
        rate - sample rate, in Hz. Set to -1 to use the default sample rate for the current voice.
        channels - MONO or STEREO
